title: Effect of processing Verdejo grape must by UHPH using non-Saccharomyces yeasts in the absence of SO2
content:
Sustainable Food Technol., 2024, 2,437-446
DOI: 10.1039/D3FB00226H, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Carlos Escott, Cristian Vaquero, Juan Manuel del Fresno, Angelo Topo, Piergiorgio Comuzzo, Carmen Gonzalez, Antonio Morata
Ultra-High Pressure Homogenization (UHPH) is an emerging non-thermal technology that can eliminate wild microorganisms from grape juice facilitating the use of non-competitive non-Saccharomyces yeast in fermentation to modulate the sensory profile.
